Package ohos.media.image

Class PropertyFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.image.common.Filter
      • ohos.media.image.PropertyFilter

  • public class PropertyFilter
extends Filter
    Provides methods for setting image Exif properties, including adding, deleting, and modifying Exif properties.
    Since:
    4
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#IMAGE

      • setPropertyInt

        public PropertyFilter setPropertyInt​(String key,
                                     int value)
        Sets an Exif property of the int type.
        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the property key, which is defined in PropertyKey.
        value - Indicates the property value.
        Returns:
        Returns this PropertyFilter object with the Exif property of the int type. This object can be used for subsequent Exif-related operations.
        Since:
        4

      • rollbackProperty

        public PropertyFilter rollbackProperty​(String key)
        Restores a specified Exif property. This method applies only to the properties that have not been applied to the source file via applyToSource(ImageSource).
        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the property key, which is defined in PropertyKey.
        Returns:
        Returns this PropertyFilter object with the restored Exif property. The object can be used for subsequent Exif-related operations.
        Since:
        4

      • restore

        public PropertyFilter restore​()
        Restores all Exif properties. This method applies only to the properties that have not been applied to the source file via applyToSource(ImageSource).
        Specified by:
        restore in class Filter
        Returns:
        Returns this PropertyFilter object with the restored Exif properties. The object can be used for subsequent Exif-related operations.
        Since:
        4

      • applyToSource

        public long applyToSource​(ImageSource source)
                   throws IOException
        Applies the configured Exif properties to the source file.

        This method requires the permission to modify the source file represented by the ImageSource object. The configured Exif properties do not take effect until this method is called.

        This method is applicable to the ImageSource object that has been created based on a File object or a specified file path.

        Specified by:
        applyToSource in class Filter
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the image source file to which the properties will be applied.
        Returns:
        Returns the size (in bytes) of the image file edited based on the Exif properties if the operation is successful; returns -1 otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the modification permission has not been obtained.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the image source is empty.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the ImageSource object has been released.
        Since:
        4
